column5: Got up early and went out to try my luck at Mountsberg resevoir.  Got there around 5:30 or so this morning and the water was like glass.... sun just coming up, so I tied on a topwater bait and tried to get my first topwater fish.  A few casts later and the water around my lure explodes.... kind of startled me at first... a quick fight and I had my first topwater largemouth, a fish about 12" or so long.  Tied on a bubblegum coloured senko (had to try them out after seeing all the talk about them) and started walking and casting.  Over the next few hours nailed another 3 largies, all around 10-12" and 2 hammerhandle pike.  It started heating up and I decided it was time to leave.  No pics since I don't have a digital camera yet.  Thanks for reading...hope to have more reports coming!
Nice read.  Congrats on your first topwater Bass.
Good report. I haven't been to Mountsberg yet this year, but have had decent success there before with pike (on topwater..... yeah baby!).Sounds like you had a fun day. Thanks for sharing.
Congrats on your topwater largie. How are the weeds at the Berg right now? I usually steer clear a couple weeks after pike opens.
sounds like a fun time.to bad that damn sun gets so hot.
